"I appeal to everyone that the state and country have to go forward, everyone has to maintain peace by accepting the order of HC," he added. Karnataka HC on Tuesday upheld hijab ban in colleges.

348.title: Man who stabbed Class 10 girl at school in Pune attempts suicide
348.article_body: A 21-year-old man who's accused of stabbing a Class 10 girl at her school farewell in Pune, later allegedly attempted suicide by consuming a poisonous substance, police said on Monday. The accused is unconscious and undergoing treatment at a hospital, a senior inspector said. The girl is stable and has been kept under observation, DCP (Zone 4) Rohidas Pawar said.

349.title: I essayed the role of tree in school plays; never got the main role: Ananya
349.article_body: Ananya Panday said she was in the background in her school plays and essayed the role of a tree, standing with her arms raised. "I'd audition but never land the main role," she added. When asked about this transiting from being in...background to being the lead actress, Ananya said, "I'm just happy that I get to be an actor."

350.title: 75% of Punjab MLAs are crorepatis, AAP's Kulwant Singh richest with ₹238-cr assets
350.article_body: The new Punjab Assembly has nearly 75% MLAs who are crorepatis, according to a report by the Association for Democratic Reforms and the Punjab Election Watch. AAP has 63 MLAs who are crorepatis including the richest Kulwant Singh who declared ₹238-crore assets. Congress has 17 crorepati MLAs, SAD has three, BJP has two, BSP has one and one is Independent.

351.title: Over 28 lakh people fled Ukraine since Russia attack: UN
351.article_body: Over 28 lakh people have fled Ukraine since Russia attacked the country, said the United Nations on Monday, making it Europe's biggest refugee crisis since World War II. European Union officials have estimated that the number of refugees could reach 50 lakh, while some have predicted the figure to be higher. Lakhs of people have reportedly been displaced within Ukraine.

352.title: Pant will become India's highest-scoring wicketkeeper in Tests: Irfan Pathan
352.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant over his performance in the Sri Lanka Tests, Irfan Pathan said the 24-year-old will end his career as India's highest run-scoring wicketkeeper-batter in Test cricket. "At such a young age, so much improvement has been seen in his cricket," added Irfan. Pant scored 96, 39 and 50 runs in the two Tests against Sri Lanka.

353.title: Real normalcy in J&K after abrogation of Article 370: Nirmala Sitharaman
353.article_body: There has been a "fake normalcy" in Jammu and Kashmir since Independence under the garb of Article 370 and after its abrogation, now there is real normalcy there, Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. "How can we say there was normalcy in Kashmir earlier when the Constitution of India was not applicable there?" Sitharaman added.

354.title: SC questions pension for Kerala ministers' staff after 2yrs service
354.article_body: Supreme Court, while taking note of an Indian Express report, has criticised Kerala government's policy of giving "life-long" pensions to state ministers' staff after only two years of service. The court was hearing a plea by Kerala transport corporation against state-owned companies' high fuel prices. "If you've...money for [pensions], why are you here for this?" it said for the plea.

355.title: Wearing hijab not an essential religious practice, says Karnataka HC as it upholds hijab ban
355.article_body: Karnataka High Court on Tuesday dismissed writ petitions filed by Muslim girl students seeking permission to wear hijab in colleges. The court held prescription of uniform as a reasonable restriction, saying that wearing of hijab is not an essential religious practice of the Islamic faith. Notably, Section 144 of CrPC is imposed in many parts of Karnataka till March 21.

356.title: Have uniformity, don't involve politics in remission cases: SC to UP govt
356.article_body: Supreme Court told the Uttar Pradesh government to not involve politics in remission cases and maintain uniformity. "We are coming across cases specifically from UP where no yardsticks are followed...Somebody goes out after nine years while others are incarcerated for more than 20 years," it added. "Follow one standard...And those standards must be followed in all cases," SC stated.

357.title: He's always ready to help: Abhimanyu on working with Akshay Kumar
357.article_body: Actor Abhimanyu Singh, speaking about working with Akshay Kumar in the upcoming film 'Bachchhan Paandey', said, "It's always fun to work with him." "He makes you feel very comfortable...[He's] always ready to help you on the set and off the set," he added. "Also, his one-liners are so funny most of the time that you can never forget," Abhimanyu said.

358.title: Poll results never surprised me, Cong going downhill since 2014: Sibal
358.article_body: Days after the election results were announced in five states, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that the results "never surprised" him. "We have been going downhill since 2014. We have lost state after state...In the meantime, there has been an exodus of some key people...those who had the confidence of the leadership...moving away from the Congress," Kapil added.

359.title: Never visualised our morality going so low: SC on misuse of COVID death aid
359.article_body: The Supreme Court hinted at directing a CAG probe over the misuse of its order and people getting COVID death compensation of ₹50,000 on the basis of fake documents issued by doctors. "We never visualised that our morality can go so low that these kinds of fake claims would be made...never thought this scheme could be misused," the court said.

360.title: US-based inFeedo, founded by 2 Indians, raises $12 million
360.article_body: US-based employee experience platform ﻿inFeedo﻿ has raised $12 million in funding from Jungle Ventures and Tiger Global. Other investors who participated in the funding included Bling Capital, Zeta Founder Bhavin Turakhia, Gainsight Co-founder Sreedhar Peddineni, Freshworks CHRO Suman Gopalan and Ankur Warikoo. The startup was founded by two Indians Tanmaya Jain and Varun Puri.

361.title: Domestic air passenger traffic nears pre-COVID-19 level: Scindia in Parliament
361.article_body: After suffering huge losses, the civil aviation industry is close to reaching pre-COVID-19 pandemic level as traffic of 3,80,000 passengers per day was recorded in December 2021, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia told the Rajya Sabha. Responding to a question by Shiv Sena MP Anil Desai, Scindia said that the domestic traffic was close to about 4,00,000 passengers before the pandemic.

362.title: Wouldn't believe I'd get paired with Deepika, I come from nowhere: Siddhant
362.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, who was last seen with actress Deepika Padukone in 'Gehraiyaan', said that if someone had told him he would be paired with the actress in a film, he wouldn't have believed it. "I come from nowhere. Chuck pebble in dark in movie theatre and person it hits would be me, less than ten years ago," Siddhant added.

363.title: Taunts over loss in Odisha rural polls makes woman attempt suicide, husband dies
363.article_body: A man allegedly hanged himself to death in Odisha's Basudevpur after his wife consumed insecticide following a fight between the couple following alleged taunts over her loss in the panchayat elections. According to the police, the man had an argument with supporters of the winning candidate. Later, a fight broke out between the couple, after which she consumed insecticide.

364.title: War will likely be over by early May, Russia will run out of resources: Ukraine
364.article_body: Oleksiy Arestovich, an adviser to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's chief of staff, has said that the war in Ukraine is likely to be over by early May when Russia runs out of resources. Talks between Ukraine and Russia have so far produced very few results other than several humanitarian corridors. The war in Ukraine began on February 24.

365.title: Twin towers in Noida to be demolished in 9 seconds using over 2,500 kg explosives
365.article_body: Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in Noida's Sector 93A will be demolished within nine seconds, according to Edifice Engineering, the firm planning the demolition. Holes will be drilled into the towers' columns to place the explosives. Around 2,500-4,000 kilograms of explosives could be required, an official said. "Loading the structure with the explosives can take 12-15 days," the official added.

366.title: Strategy formulated to promote medical tourism in India: G Kishan Reddy
366.article_body: Union Minister for Tourism G Kishan Reddy said government has formed a strategy for promoting India as a medical and wellness tourism destination. A National Medical and Wellness Tourism Board has been formed for the implementation of the roadmap, the minister said while replying to a question in Lok Sabha. E-Medical visas have been introduced for 156 countries, he added.

367.title: 30-yr-old Guj man objects to harassment of mentally unstable man, killed
367.article_body: A 30-year-old man, Amit Rathod, from Gujarat's Ahmedabad was killed by four men after he objected to harassment of a mentally unstable man. The four accused have been arrested by the police. They have been identified as Naresh Gathiyo, Ramesh Makkhi, Gautam Chavda and Jay Chino. FIR said that Rathod died after being stabbed multiple times by the accused.

368.title: Delhi to get 100 more e-vehicle charging stations by June 27
368.article_body: Hundred new e-vehicle charging stations with 500 charging points will be set up across "prime locations" in Delhi by June 27, Power Minister Satyendar Jain said. Of the 100 stations, 71 will be built in parking lots and premises of metro stations, he added. Jain further said that the charge for using the station facility would be "₹2 per unit".

369.title: Amazon accuses Future Retail, Reliance Industries of 'fraud' in newspaper ads
369.article_body: Amazon on Tuesday took out ads in newspapers, accusing Future Retail and Reliance Industries of "fraud" after Reliance took over several Future stores. Amazon and Future are currently engaged in a legal battle over the ₹24,713-crore Future-Reliance deal. In the ads, Amazon said, "These actions have been done in a clandestine manner by playing a fraud on...constitutional courts in India."

370.title: UAPA accused Ishrat Jahan gets bail in Delhi riots conspiracy case
370.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday granted bail to former Congress councillor Ishrat Jahan in connection with 2020 Northeast Delhi riots conspiracy case. She was accused under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA). She was neither physically present in Northeast Delhi for riots nor was she part of any group, the court stated. Jahan was earlier granted bail in another case.

371.title: Video of Aaradhya's speech in Hindi goes viral, dad Abhishek Bachchan reacts
371.article_body: A video of Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's daughter Aaradhya Bachchan reciting a Hindi poem has recently surfaced on the internet. The video is seemingly taken from an online Hindi elocution competition held at Aaradhya's school, which showed her praising the Hindi language. Taking to Twitter, Abhishek reacted to the compliments that Aaradhya was receiving with a folded-hand emoji.

372.title: Russia-Ukraine war could lead to global food crisis: IMF
372.article_body: The International Monetary Fund has warned that the Russia-Ukraine war can send the world's food supply into chaos as Ukrainian farmers are unable to plant crops such as wheat. It warned of global food insecurity if the war continued. Meanwhile, UN chief Antonio Guterres called for averting a "hurricane of hunger and a meltdown of the global food system".

373.title: Shreyas Iyer could be the next big thing in Indian cricket: Gavaskar
373.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar, on being asked if Shreyas Iyer could be the next big thing in Indian cricket, said, "Yes, certainly, he's looking like that." Gavaskar added, "It's very attractive batting that he has, the shots he has...He's a good-looking young man." Shreyas remained unbeaten in T20Is and scored 27, 92 and 67 in two Tests against Sri Lanka.

374.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.1 hits Arunachal Pradesh
374.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.1 hit the Pangin town in Arunachal Pradesh's Siang district on Tuesday, the National Center for Seismology (NCS) informed. "Earthquake of Magnitude: 4.1, occurred on 15-03-2022, 08:21:03 IST, Lat: 30.08 & Long: 95.18, Depth: 10 Km, Location: 215km N of Pangin, Arunachal Pradesh," NCS tweeted. Its epicentre was located 215 km north of Pangin.

375.title: Russia could use chemical weapons against Ukraine in ‘false-flag’ operation: UK
375.article_body: The UK's defence ministry has warned that Russia may attack Ukraine using chemical and biological weapons in a 'false-flag' operation, that is, by accusing Kyiv of using such weapons first. "Such an operation could take form of a faked attack, a staged 'discovery' of agents or munitions or fabricated evidence of alleged Ukrainian planning to use such weapons," it said.

376.title: Delhi police arrest 3 for supplying illegal firearms, seize 9 guns
376.article_body: Delhi police said on Monday that they've arrested three men, aged between 20 and 29, for allegedly supplying illegal firearms in the national capital and Punjab. Nine semi-automatic pistols and 12 cartridges were also recovered from the accused's possession, police added. Two accused were caught at a bus stand in Mayur Vihar, while the third accused was arrested from Ludhiana.

377.title: Hurled stone at liquor vend for dignity of women, kids: Uma Bharti to MP CM
377.article_body: In a letter to Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, former Union Minister Uma Bharti claimed she hurled a stone at a liquor shop in Bhopal for the dignity of the state's women and children. "Some women...told me that some men, after getting drunk, turned towards the women and children residing in these colonies and urinated," Bharti said.

378.title: Vivek Agnihotri trampled B'wood, created his own 'Vivekwood': RGV
378.article_body: Following the release of The Kashmir Files, Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to praise the film's director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri. He wrote that apart from the "explosive material he so daringly exposed, Vivek trampled Bollywood by creating his own 'Vivekwood'". He added this will "inspire a new breed of revolutionary filmmakers...and that's the ultimate victory more than Kashmir Files'...success".

379.title: Police open fire at diesel thieves in Bengaluru, 2 arrested
379.article_body: Bengaluru Police opened fire at a gang of four diesel thieves near KEB Circle in Jigani industrial area on Sunday. According to police, the gang had been stealing petrol from parked vehicles for days and when the police team caught them, the accused tried to attack the officers. Police added, main accused, Srinivasa Raju, was shot at and arrested.

380.title: Gandhis will take Congress to a situation where it won't be visible: Assam CM
380.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that the Gandhis will take Congress to a situation where it won't be visible even in panchayat elections in the days to come. "Successive defeats in elections have proved that the Gandhis cannot lead Congress to victory," Sarma added. The Congress party lost in all the five states where Assembly polls were held recently.

381.title: Gurugram businesswoman cheated of ₹6 lakh by fake manufacturing firm
381.article_body: The Gurugram Police booked several unidentified suspects of a fake manufacturing firm for allegedly cheating a 36-years-old businesswoman of ₹6 lakh. The victim, Gunjan Sharma, owns an electronic devices showroom and she allegedly ordered 100 LED TVs and 20 ACs worth ₹12 lakh from the fake firm last year. After making 50% advance payment, Sharma did not receive the products.

382.title: Filmmaker Ahmed Khan arrives in his 'Batmobile' to watch 'The Batman', pics go viral
382.article_body: Pictures have gone viral on social media showing choreographer-director Ahmed Khan arriving at a theatre in Mumbai in his 'Batmobile' to watch 'The Batman'. Ahmed's car is based on the vehicle driven by Hollywood star Michael Keaton in 1989's 'Batman' and 1992's 'Batman Returns'. He had gifted the limited-edition Batmobile to his wife Shaira Khan on her birthday last year.

383.title: WWE legend Razor Ramon dies at 63 after suffering 3 heart attacks following hip surgery
383.article_body: WWE Hall of Famer Scott Hall, popularly known as Razor Ramon, died aged 63 after suffering three heart attacks following a hip surgery. He had started his career in 1984 and had joined World Championship Wrestling in 1991 as The Diamond Studd. He signed with WWE in 1992 as Cuban-American character Razor Ramon. He was a four-time WWE Intercontinental Champion.

384.title: Video shows the moment kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal was shot dead in Punjab
384.article_body: A video showing the moment international kabaddi player Sandeep Nangal was shot dead in Punjab has surfaced online. A personal rivalry or professional jealousy could be the reason behind the incident, police said. Sandeep was among top five kabaddi players of the world and head of Major Kabaddi League Federation. Sandeep is survived by his parents, wife and two sons.

385.title: 4 dead, 15 hurt as fire causes cylinder blast in building in J&K
385.article_body: Four people, including a child, have died and 15 injured after a fire broke out at a scrap shop in a building in Jammu and Kashmir's Jammu on Monday. The fire engulfed the entire building and some LPG cylinders exploded, SSP Chandan Kohli said. The Union Territory's L-G Manoj Sinha's Office announced a ₹5 lakh ex-gratia for the deceased's families.

386.title: A year after Suez Canal blocking, another giant Evergreen ship runs aground in US
386.article_body: A year after a giant container ship got stuck in the Suez Canal for nearly a week and disrupted global trade, another Evergreen Marine Corp vessel has run aground. The 334-metre vessel was en route to Virginia when it got stuck in US' Chesapeake Bay. It "isn't preventing other ships from transiting to the Port of Baltimore", an official said.

387.title: Last relationship ended 7 years ago, I would love to be in love: Rahul Bose
387.article_body: Actor Rahul Bose said that he has had five very long relationships in his life and that the last one finished seven years ago. "I've had a life full of romantic love. Would I like another relationship, or five, or ten? Of course. I would love to be in love, it would be fantastic," Rahul added.

388.title: Sunny Deol shares BTS video from sets of 1999 film 'Dillagi' featuring Bobby
388.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol took to Instagram to share a behind-the-scenes (BTS) video from the sets of his 1999 film 'Dillagi'. The video includes various BTS shots from 'Dillagi', featuring Bobby Deol and Urmila Matondkar. "Received this today. Beautiful memories Bob," Sunny wrote. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "Bobby's iconic hairstyle", while another fan wrote, "We want a sequel."

389.title: We have a good team, but batters didn't capitalise on conditions: Karunaratne
389.article_body: After losing both the Tests against India, Sri Lanka captain Dimuth Karunaratne said they had a good team but their batters didn't capitalise on conditions during the series. "The bowling was good, but we kept bowling loose deliveries every now and then," he added. Karunaratne scored 107 runs during their second innings in the pink-ball Test.

390.title: ICJ to pass verdict on Ukraine's case against Russia over invasion on Wednesday
390.article_body: The International Court of Justice would deliver its verdict on Ukraine's case against Russia over the invasion on Wednesday. Ukraine has accused Russia of attempting to justify its attack under an international convention by falsely claiming that the former committed genocide in some regions. Notably, Russia did not show up at the hearing held on March 7.

391.title: Self-proclaimed godman attempts to sacrifice 9-yr-old nephew, held in Thane
391.article_body: Police have arrested 40-year-old self-proclaimed godman. Kuldip Nikam, in Thane, for attempting to offer his 9-year-old nephew as "sacrifice". Nikam claimed that boy was possessed by evil spirit and that he would turn out to be a murderer and sexual assaulter in future. Police said that Nikam would regularly hint that the boy was dangerous and should be kept away.

392.title: Ukraine Prez shares letter he wrote to family of journalist shot dead by Russian forces
392.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has shared the letter that he wrote to the family of US journalist Brent Renaud, who was killed by Russian forces in Irpin. "With all his courage and determination, he travelled to the most dangerous war zones to film the unprecedented ruthlessness and evil, also inflicted on our nation by the aggressor state," Zelenskyy wrote.

393.title: India reports 2,568 new COVID-19 cases, 97 deaths in 24 hours
393.article_body: India has reported 2,568 new COVID-19 cases and 97 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 97 deaths, 26 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 71 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,15,974, and the active cases declined to 33,917.

394.title: Outgoing BJP clears Pune civic body's draft budget of ₹9,716 cr
394.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) outgoing ruling party BJP on Monday cleared the draft civic budget of ₹9,716 crore for 2022-23. "We have included a lot of public interest schemes and projects in it," chairperson of the standing committee Hemant Rasane said. PMC school students will be given free tablets for online education at a cost of ₹10 crore.

395.title: Businessman's wife molested in Hyd's KBR Park, police launch manhunt
395.article_body: A Hyderabad-based businessman alleged that his wife was molested by an unknown assailant in KBR Park on Saturday morning. "All CCTV cameras are defunct at KBR Park," the businessman wrote on Twitter while reporting the incident. However, Banjara Hills ACP M Sudarshan said the victim has not lodged a written complaint, adding the police are trying to identify the accused.

396.title: We'll ensure Ukraine returnees complete their courses: Kerala CM
396.article_body: Kerala government will take all possible steps, after informing the Centre and NMC, for enabling Indian students coming from Ukraine to complete their courses in medicine and other subjects, CM Pinarayi Vijayan said. So far, 3,379 Malayali students have been repatriated to Kerala with the help of the Centre and the NORKA Development Offices in Delhi and Mumbai, CM added.

397.title: Rare Brambling spotted in Delhi-NCR for the first time
397.article_body: For the first time in Delhi and National Capital Region, birdwatchers spotted a rare non-breeding male Brambling in Gurugram's Bhondsi area on Sunday. The bird is usually found in northern Europe or in the western and higher Himalayas and Kashmir Valley in India. "There is no historical record of it being sighted in the plains before this," a birder said.

398.title: NRI groom, parents booked for fraud in Mohali
398.article_body: Mohali Police have booked an NRI groom and his parents for refusing to marry the woman he got engaged to in 2018. While the accused, Deepanshu Dhiman, moved to Australia, his parents kept introducing the woman to their relatives as their daughter-in-law. In 2021, another woman claiming to be in relation with Deepanshu told the woman he wouldn't marry her.

399.title: People in the West were shocked to see the real images of Kashmir: Vivek
399.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri said that the film made the West sit up and take notice. "We went from place to place and people were...shocked to see the real images of Kashmir," he added. Vivek said there has been a lot of disinformation regarding Kashmir in the West. "Nobody knows about what happened to Kashmiri Pandits," he added.

400.title: Highway project Bharatmala Pariyojana Phase-I to be delayed by 5 yrs: Govt
400.article_body: The Centre’s flagship programme for national highways, Bharatmala Pariyojana (BMP) Phase-I, which was initially proposed to be completed by 2022, will now be completed by 2027. Owing to the five-year delay, the estimated project cost has doubled from ₹5.35 lakh crore to ₹10.63 lakh crore. This information was furnished by the Union Ministry of Road Transport and Highways.
